content:
That's a great plan! Checking out both H&M and Madewell will give you a good sense of the styles and prices they offer. While you're shopping, you might also consider stopping by a few other stores that align with your style and budget. Here are a few suggestions:

* Zara: Since you already have a pair of high-waisted jeans from Zara, you might want to check out their blouse selection as well. They often have a wide range of styles, from basic to trendy, and their prices are generally similar to H&M's.
* J.Crew Factory: If you're looking for a more classic, preppy style, J.Crew Factory might be worth a visit. They often have a wide range of blouses with subtle details like stripes, polka dots, or ruffles.
* Everlane: Everlane is a great destination for high-quality, minimalist pieces. They often have a range of blouses made from sustainable materials, and their prices are generally more affordable than Madewell's.
* Loft: If you're looking for a more feminine, romantic style, Loft might be a great option. They often have a wide range of blouses with lace, ruffles, or other details that add a touch of whimsy to your outfit.

Remember, the key is to stay focused on your goals and budget. You're looking for a blouse to pair with your black jeans and Stuart Weitzman boots, so try to stick to pieces that fit that vision. Don't feel pressured to browse every store or try on a million different options – just take your time, and trust your instincts.

One final tip: If you do end up finding a blouse you love, consider trying it on with your jeans and boots to make sure it's a great combination. You might also want to take a photo of yourself in the outfit to get a better sense of how it looks from different angles. Happy shopping!
